title: ICE on incremental build when implementing From for Cow

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code I don't have a minimal example, but this commit hit the ICE: [Mafii/rusty-yarn-spinner@`770b5b4` (#16)](https://github.com/Mafii/rusty-yarn-spinner/pull/16/commits/770b5b4facbf289dffadd058e197e3c2466b9c09), while this one fixed it: [Mafii/rusty-yarn-spinner@`8672a1f` (#16)](https://github.com/Mafii/rusty-yarn-spinner/pull/16/commits/8672a1fc451d31a3701a6548571806541c807113). Undoing the fix commit reintroduced the ICE until I ran a `cargo clean` as described below. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` 1.71.0-nightly (d0f204e4d 2023-04-16) ``` ### Error output ``` internal compiler error: encountered incremental compilation error with mir_built(d44709127f11d770-d5588de0332f7ff2) | = help: This is a known issue with the compiler. Run `cargo clean -p rusty_yarn_spinner_core` or `cargo clean` to allow your project to compile = note: Please follow the instructions below to create a bug report with the provided information = note: See for more information ``` I tried running the provided command, but it got the name wrong. The crate is actually kebab-cased (`rusty-yarn-spinner-core`), so I ran the fixed command and then tried `cargo test` again, which worked.
Backtrace
